title: 河圖洛書
description: Fundamental numeric diagrams in Chinese cosmology, traditionally associated with the origins of the I Ching
source: Traditional Chinese cosmology, referenced in 繫辭傳

hetu.legend: According to tradition, the Hetu emerged from the Yellow River on the back of a dragon-horse during the reign of Fu Xi
hetu.reference: 繫辭上傳: 河出圖，洛出書，聖人則之

structure.description: 10 numbers arranged in a cross pattern representing the five phases

天地之數.note: 天數五，地數五，五位相得而各有合

luoshu.legend: According to tradition, the Luoshu appeared on the back of a turtle emerging from the Luo River during the reign of Yu the Great

structure.description: 3x3 magic square where all rows, columns, and diagonals sum to 15

king_wen_bagua_correlation.description: The Luoshu numbers correspond to the King Wen (Later Heaven) trigram arrangement

mathematical_properties.note: The only 3x3 normal magic square (up to rotation and reflection)

relationship.hetu_luoshu_connection: 河圖為體，洛書為用 (Hetu is the substance, Luoshu is the function)
philosophical_significance: Hetu represents the cosmic order of creation (先天)
Luoshu represents the practical order of application (後天)
Together they form the numerical foundation of I Ching cosmology

iching_connection.fuxi_bagua: Associated with Hetu (River Chart) - represents cosmic/natural order
iching_connection.king_wen_bagua: Associated with Luoshu (Luo Writing) - represents practical/human order
iching_connection.hexagram_derivation: The 64 hexagrams can be derived from combinations based on these numeric patterns

computational_relevance: Luoshu is the earliest known magic square (c. 2800 BCE traditionally)
The 3x3 structure relates to ternary/base-3 representations
Complementary pairs (summing to 10) mirror yin-yang balance
Magic constant 15 = sum of trigram generation numbers
pattern_connections: Luoshu numbers 1-9 map directly to King Wen trigram positions
This provides numerical basis for trigram-direction associations
The center 5 represents balance/earth - no trigram assigned
